DOC.brief_summary: Alcohol abuse is associated with a variety of clinical diseases, but studies on prevalence of different somatic diseases among alcohol abusers are lacking. Studies on populations in an out-day patients' clinic are also lacking. The investigators aim to study somatic health standard in an out-day patients' clinic population of alcohol abusers, with regard to prevalence of different kinds of somatic diseases, and how the interaction of somatic and psychiatric treatment can influence on patients quality of life. Clinical examination including blood samples and echocardiographic examinations in all participants, other additional examinations (as x-ray, CT or MRI if indicated by clinical findings).
DOC.brief_title: Somatic Disease Among Alcohol Abusers in an Out-day Patients' Clinic
DOC.detailed_description: Retrospective methods will be used to study former somatic disease, cross-section design to study present somatic disease and prospective design to study quality of life, psychiatric and somatic health after combination of psychiatric and somatic examinations and treatment.
DOC.criteria: Alcohol abusers reffered to the outday patients' clinic at Dep. of Psychiatry, Levanger Hospital, Norway Not consenting to participate Not able to consent
